text: I think we're just going to use google docs to replace it, which are ubiquitous across the company. Confluence had a edit-publish wiki-style model that we didn't really need and it was just money down the drain when we have other ways of sharing information.

text: I don't think the markdown is necessarily the problem, but for non-technical people the edit-publish style is much easier than setting up and learning git, learning markdown, and keeping the website in sync. text: It's not like the only options are confluence or command line, there's a huge space of options between those things.  A simple web app with an entry field for markdown and a rendering next to it and a little button that shows a markdown cheatsheet would be great.  Anyone could use something like that.
